title: Regarding Samsung...
comment: Nice small gadget, more comfortable than command-line switching. And it can work on the Samsung devices, as long as you compile your own kernel from Samsung sources, with undefined (commented out) CONFIG_ALWAYS_ENFORCE in kernel/security/selinux/Makefile (no other chance, unfortunately).
FolderMount on Lollipop, at last! Thanks :D

title: Works on Lollipop
comment: Since the latest Android Lollipop 5.0.2 has SELinux set to enforcing, the apps that require root don't work right. Point is, the apps have root access but SELinux restricts them. So I used this app to set SELinux to Permissive AND IT STILL WORKS! 10/10 BRAVO AUTHOR! I would recommend this app to everyone on Android Lollipop.

title: Yea! Now writing NFS hard disk from Nexus 7
comment: This was the final piece of the puzzle to get a WD 750GB Elements usb disk drive working on Android 4.4. It is NFS formatted and with StickMount and its NFS plug-in, I  can now copy my camera SD cards directly to the hard drive.  Its slow (USB2, I suspectg), but it works!  I use a powered USB hub to minimize the power load on the Nexus 7.

title: Fixed SSH access to Debian on KitKat
comment: I use Complete Linux Installer to run Debian Jessie on low-cost Android tablets for development purposes.  With Jelly Bean, I never had any issues. On KitKat tablets, I can launch Debian but cannot access via SSH nor are some other things permitted (like changing root password).  After discovering that KitKat uses SELinux in Enforcing mode and that setting it to Permissive might resolve my issue, I installed this app, clicked "Permissive" and now I can SSH to the Debian environment.

title: 4 stars since it does change it, but...
comment: I gave this 4 stars since it does change the mode, but it locks down my phone so that everything crashes and I had to fight to get into the app to change the setting to permissive again. In that time frame others apps could programmatically change the setting to permissive easily and make this program pointless.  To avoid people getting locked out of their phone, have the software detect if it crashed last time and set it back to permissive if it did.  After the trial run, make it run at boot.
